body:
Hello @wzj5133329, thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our [Custom Training Tutorial](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) to get started, and see our [Google Colab Notebook](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb), [Docker Image](https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3), and [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) for example environments. 
  
If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and **minimum viable code to reproduce your issue**, otherwise we can not help you.

@wzj5133329 look at your train*.jpg.

How do you expect me to tell you if your own label for your custom data is 'wrong'?
@wzj5133329 ah, sort order doesn't matter. In any case, look at your train*.jpg that's created once training starts to verify your labels.

> @wzj5133329 ah, sort order doesn't matter. In any case, look at your train*.jpg that's created once training starts to verify your labels.

you mean the train_batch0.jpg? There is only one type on this picture，but in fact some lable.txt has two class type。I have checked it ,Do you think anything else could be wrong？

@wzj5133329 if your label text files do not correspond to what you see in your jpgs then yes, there is something wrong with your custom data. 

See https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data

> @wzj5133329 if your label text files do not correspond to what you see in your jpgs then yes, there is something wrong with your custom data.
> 
> See https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data

emmm,ok,I will check it again！ Thanks a lot!

> > @wzj5133329 if your label text files do not correspond to what you see in your jpgs then yes, there is something wrong with your custom data.
> > See https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data
> 
> emmm,ok,I will check it again！ Thanks a lot!

Hi, do you have any ideas about how to solve the problem?

> > > @wzj5133329 if your label text files do not correspond to what you see in your jpgs then yes, there is something wrong with your custom data.
> > > See https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data
> > 
> > 
> > emmm,ok,I will check it again！ Thanks a lot!
> 
> Hi, do you have any ideas about how to solve the problem?

you could check code in datasets.py 
def random_affine(img, targets=(), degrees=10, translate=.1, scale=.1, shear=10, border=0):
 i = (w > 4) & (h > 4) & (area / (area0 * s + 1e-16) > 0.2) & (ar < 10)  ，the aspect ratio is limited here ,hope it help you !

@wzj5133329 Hi! Thank you for your reply.  I  did not apply your method but checked the labels.npy file which contains previous readings and I found that I forgot to delete it because the previous one contains only one label while the newer has two classes. This is my case but anyway thank you!
